title: H2Se and O2F2 - assign oxidation numbers

content.prompt:
H2Se(g) + 4 O2F2(g) â†’ SeF6(g) + 2 HF(g) + 4 O2(g)

Which of the following is true regarding the reaction represented above?

choices.label: The oxidation number of O does not change.
The oxidation number of H changes from -1 to +1.
The oxidation number of F changes from +1 to -1.
The oxidation number of Se changes from -2 to +6.

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
